dt.t: Liberty {wi}consists{/wi} in the absence of obstructions …
Breakfast {wi}consisted{/wi} of cereal, milk, and fruit.

et: borrowed from Middle French & Latin; Middle French {it}consister{/it} "to lie, reside (in), stay permanently, comprise," borrowed from Latin {it}consistere{/it} "to stop moving, come to a halt, remain at the same level, take up a position, reside, be composed (of), be established (in a given state), come into existence," from {it}con-{/it} {et_link|con-|com-} + {it}sistere{/it} "to cause to stand, assume a standing position, place, check, halt" {ma}{mat|assist:1|}{/ma}

dt: {bc}makeup or composition (as of coal sizes or a railroad train) by classes, types, or grades and arrangement

shortdef: makeup or composition (as of coal sizes or a railroad train) by classes, types, or grades and arrangement

dt: {bc}to have (something) as an essential or main part

dt.t: Happiness {it}consists in{/it} being satisfied with what you have.

shortdef: to have (something) as an essential or main part

dt: {bc}to be formed or made up of (specified things or people)

dt.t: Breakfast {it}consisted of{/it} cereal, fruit, and orange juice.
His wardrobe {it}consists{/it} almost entirely {it}of{/it} jeans and T-shirts.

shortdef: to be formed or made up of (specified things or people)
